120.speaker: Wyll
120.text: I hope Astarion makes you happy. You deserve it.

95.speaker: Player
95.text: Thanks. That means a lot coming from you.

128.speaker: Wyll
128.text: You're the author of your own story. You get to choose who plays which part.

34.speaker: Wyll
34.text: If it is a story worth telling, then it is a life worth living.

55.speaker: Player
55.text: I enjoyed our time together. But I want to be friends, nothing more.

106.speaker: Wyll
106.text: 'Nothing more?' Ah, but to be friends with you is no compromise - it is an achievement unto itself.

72.speaker: Wyll
72.text: We aren't 'just' friends. We are friends. No qualifications and no apologies needed.

39.speaker: Player
39.text: You sound regretful. Or am I wrong?

133.speaker: Wyll
133.text: I'd been letting my mind wander. Wondering what it would be like to...

16.speaker: Wyll
16.text: ...well, to hold your hand. To dance with you. To smile coyly, and have you smile back.

57.speaker: Player
57.text: I want that too, to be honest.

144.speaker: Player
144.text: I'll break it off with him. I want to see where things go with you.

17.speaker: Wyll
17.text: Really? Oh dear - I swear can feel my horns flushing.

77.speaker: Wyll
77.text: Thank you, for giving me the chance to show you the best of me. I won't let you down.

93.speaker: Wyll
93.text: Really? Oh dear - am I blushing? I feel like I'm blushing.

48.speaker: Player
48.text: I'll break it off with her. I want to see where things go with you.

30.speaker: Player
30.text: I'll break it off with her. I want to see where things go with you.

68.speaker: Player
68.text: I'll break it off with her. I want to see where things go with you.

126.speaker: Player
126.text: Sorry, but I can't let her go - I'm staying with her.

36.speaker: Player
36.text: I'll break it off with him. I want to see where things go with you.

116.speaker: Player
116.text: Sorry, but I can't let him go - I'm staying with him.

138.speaker: Wyll
138.text: Ah. Well, you're the author of your own story. You get to choose who plays which part.

105.speaker: Wyll
105.text: Just do me a favour - make it a story worth telling, a life worth living. You deserve nothing less.

78.speaker: Player
78.text: I'm sorry, Wyll. I've made my choice.

59.speaker: Wyll
59.text: Ouch. A midwinter bath in the Chionthar would have been less chilling.

14.speaker: Wyll
14.text: Look - you're the author of your own story. You get to choose who plays which part.

125.speaker: Wyll
125.text: That's it? Well then. So what's on your mind?

10.speaker: Wyll
10.text: I hope Lae'zel makes you happy. You deserve it.
10.context: InternalNodeContext: Pre-partnered with companion, partnered with Gale.

64.speaker: Wyll
64.text: I hope Lae'zel makes you happy. You deserve it.

28.speaker: Player
28.text: Thanks. That means a lot coming from you.

18.speaker: Player
18.text: I enjoyed our time together. But I want to be friends, nothing more.

26.speaker: Wyll
26.text: I've seen that sparkle in your eye, that extra I-don't-know-what. Even a blind derro couldn't miss it.
26.context: InternalNodeContext: Pre-partnered with companion, partnered with Gale.

32.speaker: Wyll
32.text: I hope Shadowheart makes you happy. You deserve it.

91.speaker: Player
91.text: Thanks. That means a lot coming from you.

96.speaker: Player
96.text: I enjoyed our time together. But I want to be friends, nothing more.

25.speaker: Wyll
25.text: I was certain you'd fallen for Karlach, and why wouldn't you? She's got grit, that one.

11.speaker: Wyll
11.text: What was it that changed your mind?

147.speaker: Player
147.text: It's the horns. They drive me mad.

83.speaker: Wyll
83.text: And to think how much time I've spent wishing I could rip them off.

131.speaker: Wyll
131.text: Shit - I'm being insensitive. I'm sorry. They just take some getting used to.

112.speaker: Player
112.text: You're kind, you're valiant. Of course I'd choose you.

12.speaker: Wyll
12.text: I'm glad you see my very best self. In the moments I'm any less than that, I hope I'll still find you near.

53.speaker: Player
53.text: My mind kept returning to our dance. I want more nights just like it.

67.speaker: Wyll
67.text: And we'll have plenty, if I have my way.

23.speaker: Wyll
23.text: Thank you, for seeing the best in me, and showing me the best in you.

107.speaker: Player
107.text: Just a whim, I suppose. Let's go with it and see what happens.

13.speaker: Wyll
13.text: It was on a whim that I smelled an orchard's sweetest flowers and plucked its sweetest fruit.

94.speaker: Wyll
94.text: If we can find such pleasures in each other, our time together is well spent.

89.speaker: Wyll
89.text: I couldn't want for a better answer.

40.speaker: Wyll
40.text: One of my eyes might be made of stone, but that doesn't mean I'm blind to the obvious.
40.context: InternalNodeContext: DID ACT 2 romance with Wyll then dumped him in another characters' inparty

43.speaker: Wyll
43.text: One of my eyes might be made of stone, but that doesn't mean I'm blind to the obvious.
43.context: InternalNodeContext: DID ACT 2 romance with Wyll then dumped him in another characters' inparty

21.speaker: Wyll
21.text: I hope Astarion makes you happy.
21.context: InternalNodeContext: PLAYER has only done act 1 Astarion scene - that means they just slept with him

110.speaker: Player
110.text: Truth be told, I'm starting to regret my choice.
110.context: NodeContext: A little sad, but just a litte. Being broken up with.

2.speaker: Wyll
2.text: Don't. You're the author of your own story. I wish I got to play a bigger role in it -
2.context: NodeContext: A little sad, but just a litte. Being broken up with.

22.speaker: Wyll
22.text: - but do me a favour, and make sure it's one worth telling.

127.speaker: Player
127.text: I enjoyed our time together. But I want to be friends, nothing more.
127.context: NodeContext: A little sad, but just a litte. Being broken up with.

132.speaker: Wyll
132.text: I won't pretend I'm not hurt. But I also won't deny that your friendship alone is a magnificent gift.
132.context: NodeContext: A little sad, but just a litte. Being broken up with.

92.speaker: Wyll
92.text: If friendship is what you're offering, it's an honour to accept.

35.speaker: Player
35.text: I was looking for excitement. All you gave me was a dance.
35.context: NodeContext: A little sad, but just a litte. Being broken up with.

82.speaker: Wyll
82.text: It was more than just dancing to me. It was a door to an uncharted world, ours alone to explore.
82.context: NodeContext: A little sad, but just a litte. Being broken up with.

87.speaker: Wyll
87.text: I don't resent you for closing the door. But I'm sad I'll never know what's on the other side of it.

143.speaker: Player
143.context: NodeContext: A little sad, but just a litte. Being broken up with.

109.speaker: Wyll
109.text: That's it, then - not even a single parting word? Then at least let me offer some to you:
109.context: NodeContext: A little sad, but just a litte. Being broken up with.

50.speaker: Wyll
50.text: 'May the brightest sun always face you, and the pouring rains fall behind.'
50.context: NodeContext: A little sad, but just a litte. Being broken up with.

90.speaker: Wyll
90.text: No more dances, no more touches. But I'm glad, all things considered, I can still call you 'friend'.
90.context: NodeContext: A little sad, but just a litte. Being broken up with.

88.speaker: Wyll
88.text: I hope Karlach makes you happy.

139.speaker: Wyll
139.text: I hope Lae'zel makes you happy.

79.speaker: Wyll
79.text: I hope Gale makes you happy.

148.speaker: Wyll
148.text: I hope Shadowheart makes you happy.

44.speaker: Wyll
44.text: I hope you're happy. I just wish I could have been the one to make you so.

71.speaker: Wyll
71.text: You and Gale seemed a match made in the heavens. I'm not half so clever as him. Or is it 'clever as he'?

58.speaker: Wyll
58.text: I don't think I realised just how much you cared for me.
58.context: InternalNodeContext: DID ACT 2 romance with Wyll, and dumped another character in their inparty

47.speaker: Wyll
47.text: I was certain you'd fallen for Astarion, the charming rapscallion that he is.

60.speaker: Wyll
60.text: I've seen that sparkle in your eye, that extra I-don't-know-what. Even a blind derro couldn't miss it.
60.context: InternalNodeContext: Pre-partnered with companion, partnered with Gale.

75.speaker: Wyll
75.text: Imagine that - I was just thinking of you. Of us, really.
75.context: NodeContext: Very slightly hurt, but holding it back.

20.speaker: Wyll
20.text: Some time back, I'd planned a special evening, just the two of us.
20.context: NodeContext: Very slightly hurt, but holding it back.

65.speaker: Wyll
65.text: But what with the tadpoles and towers and abductions and rescues, life had other ideas.
65.context: NodeContext: Very slightly hurt, but holding it back.

54.speaker: Player
54.text: There's no time like the present. How about tonight?
54.context: NodeContext: Very slightly hurt, but holding it back.

5.speaker: Player
5.text: That's very sweet of you. What kind of evening?
5.context: NodeContext: Very slightly hurt, but holding it back.

135.speaker: Wyll
135.text: A bit of talking, a bit of dancing. Nothing too fancy. Just an oasis of normalcy in a world turned on its head.

19.speaker: Wyll
19.text: But truth is, I'd rather be friends than lovers. Romance is all peaks and valleys, big gains and bigger losses.

63.speaker: Wyll
63.text: What we have is resolute. I wouldn't trade that for all the material plane.

137.speaker: Player
137.text: Then life did us a favour. We're allies, Wyll, nothing more.
137.context: NodeContext: Very slightly hurt, but holding it back.

73.speaker: Wyll
73.text: So we are. Friends, even, if I might say so.

104.speaker: Player
104.context: NodeContext: Very slightly hurt, but holding it back.

51.speaker: Wyll
51.text: Well, er, anything on your mind?
51.context: NodeContext: Very slightly hurt, but holding it back.

99.speaker: Wyll
99.text: I was certain you'd stick with Lae'zel. I can't match her intensity, though I think you've already guessed.

98.speaker: Wyll
98.text: I hope Gale makes you happy. You deserve it.
98.context: InternalNodeContext: Player did act 1 romance scene with Wyll, but not act 2 yet. Player did act 2 romanec scene with another character.

52.speaker: Wyll
52.text: I hope Gale makes you happy. You deserve it.

3.speaker: Player
3.text: Thanks. That means a lot coming from you.

9.speaker: Wyll
9.text: I always figured him for a clever one. By falling for you, he proved it beyond a shadow of a doubt.

62.speaker: Wyll
62.text: Go - take his hand, write your story. I know you will make it one worth hearing.

1.speaker: Player
1.text: I enjoyed our time together. But I want to be friends, nothing more.

103.speaker: Wyll
103.text: I've seen that sparkle in your eye, that extra I-don't-know-what. Even a blind derro couldn't miss it.
103.context: InternalNodeContext: Player did act 1 romance scene with Wyll, but not act 2 yet. Player did act 2 romanec scene with another character.

113.speaker: Wyll
113.text: I've seen that sparkle in your eye, that extra I-don't-know-what. Even a blind derro couldn't miss it.
113.context: InternalNodeContext: Player did act 1 romance scene with Wyll, but not act 2 yet. Player did act 2 romanec scene with another character.

61.speaker: Wyll
61.text: I hope Karlach makes you happy. You deserve it.

76.speaker: Player
76.text: Thanks. That means a lot coming from you.

129.speaker: Wyll
129.text: She has heart, that one. I mean - well, you know what I mean. Take good care of her. And make sure she takes care of you.

84.speaker: Player
84.text: I enjoyed our time together. But I want to be friends, nothing more.

122.speaker: Wyll
122.text: The way you looked at Shadowheart, I was so sure you'd fallen.

124.speaker: Wyll
124.text: The way you looked at Shadowheart, I was so sure you'd fallen.

121.speaker: Wyll
121.text: The way you looked at Shadowheart, I was so sure you'd fallen.
